name: Teaching Writing Practicum I
long_desc: This practicum, a requirement for new FirstYear Writing teachers who are graduate student instructors, supports new firstyear writing teachers. Within the context of these meetings, course leads cover various methods for conducting lesson plans, facilitating group work and responding to student writing. At points within the semester, with their course leads, new graduate student instructors calibrate expectations for effective student writing at Carnegie Mellon. Successful completion of the course requires effective teaching as a T.A. in mini 1 and effective teaching as instructor of record in mini 2.

custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: they should have taken 76824, theory & design of writing instruction
custom_fields.assessment_structure: their interactions with students, comments on student papers, ability to design lesson plans and deliver instruction consistent with the objectives of their course assignments
custom_fields.learning_resources: Canvas site with all teaching materials for their courses
